comments.value: Jamie and I spoke about this in an email before I uploaded the contents of the Excel minisite.  I mentioned that we'd need http://www.london2012.com/excelconsultation to redirect to the homepage of the minisite, which now sits at http://www.london2012.com/excel/home.html .  I think this might have been set up wrong, as now when I try to type the correct full URL: http://www.london2012.com/excel/home.html i'm redirected to http://www.london2012.com/excelconsultation/home.html

Hi Finn, 

Will happily change the redirect, it's pattern matching on the first bit of the path instead of exact matching.

but out of interest why have you got an index page called home.html rather than index.html (the later will work even if the index.html bit is omitted much like the home page of the actual site or any other section)
Was blindly following the structure of the previous minisites, had wondered about that myself :-)

Hi Finn,

/excel redirects to /excelconsultation/home.html

It may take a while to publish / sync.

* leave it for now as ti works, but in future it probably makes sense to call the index page index.html (rather than home.html)
Cool, thanks Jamie

This seems to be happening again after not being a problem for a bit :-/

Reading your description above, i realise I wasn't quite paying attention at the time, but I think you have it the wrong way round perhaps?

What i'd like is that when people type http://www.london2012.com/excelconsultation, they're redirected to http://www.london2012.com/excel/home.html

Can you sort that for me and remove any other redirects that have been set up for this.  The one described above is the only one we're after.

Very odd, it looks like it got reverted back to the old version.

Have just corrected (publishing now)

Looking at why this happened, possibly Marna already had the file open and saved it after I had made my changes, checking the history now.

Closing this ticket, well one half of it, realised that increasing the number of videos actually didn't work (as expected) as we don't have any JS to deal with with more than one video.

http://projects.cogapp.com/clients/LOCOG/html/general_content_with_children_6.php

thanks

Jamie

what's the scoop with this, Jamie?  next steps?

We're talking apple/pear guv'nor (as the bloke on the fruit stall down in Borough market would say)

Flash is a bit like a video or an .exe file/application, you code it up and then press save and it spits our a Flash movie that you host on your site, you can't selectively take bits from a Flash movie and apply it to a HTML page. HTML also expects to be contained in the page (the webcam overlay works by actually replacing the image with a flash movie, it's not really an 'overlay' as such).

We could get something like the attached mock-up working withing a day in Javascript, ie. grey out the background and display next<->prev buttons to let you brows all the images on that gallery thumbnails page.

You mean the attached mock up you came up with?  May be worth doing that if it's just a day's work. From the screenshot it's a bit hard to tell how big that photo is.  Do you think it's worth adding in a link that says, 'see full size' that takes you through to the existing individual photo page?  And if javascript is turned off...it will work as it does now?

For the future, though, do you think it would be possible to re-create the *look* of what Stamen has done?  It's just so...pretty. And it works really well, I think.  And it would be nice to be consistent.  

Sorry, I know that flash is a totally different can of worms, but for some reason I had it in my head that their interface was javascript for the galleries.

Hi Liz,

Yes, the attached mock-up (or something similar)

I was imagining we show the image the same size as on the actual photo page, with the title / caption / date under it.

Not sure if a link though to the image on the light box/pop up will get confusing, but will be easy to add one and see (my preference would be to leave it off and keep the number of option on the pop up to just prev, next and close).

The idea is we use this on the 'gallery' or 'latest' view pages
http://www.london2012.com/photos/search.php?tag=olympic+stadium

As for time expect we'd expect get this all completed within a day..

Shall we make a start on it?

Longer term -> We can look at what Stamen did and see if we can come up with something similar using Javascript. Using Flash in a pop up a show/hide layer could be tricky to get right. Is the attached what you we're thinking of re-Stamen? (what they call slideshows)

Thanks !

Jamie

Go for it. Let's get started.

 

And if you're showing them full size, then no need to have a
click-through, I don't think.

 

Please don't put live when you're done - I'd like to distribute a

Ello

We don't have many events at the moment, so we're thinking that until we get to Open Weekend this year, there's no need to have an 'All events in the next 3 days' option on the events listings at http://www.london2012.com/events.  Could we remove that filter option for now please and have that filter default to 'Any date' so it at least shows people we have some events?

Also, Debs has asked can we capitalise the first letter of each of the 'Event Date' filter options (eg 'All events in the next week' as opposed to 'all events in the next week' please?

Lars could you take a look at this and add an amount in for actual days once done (imagining 0.5 day)

thanks

Jamie

Hi all Hope you had a good Christmas! I've just noticed this news story showing up quite recently on the news index as the actual page is dated 25 Nov, but in fact the url says it was from 2008: http://www.london2012.com/press/media-releases/2008/08/olympic-park-big- build-opens-up-to-local-people.php Also this page is strangely being linked to on the news index too - seems to be a video hub? http://www.london2012.com/videos/news-video.php Finally, for some reason media releases are being pulled through too (see Sustainability one below). This seems to be happening on quite a few stories. Thanks Alex Alexandra Brown Marketing Executive (New Media) Communications Olympic Delivery Authority Mailpoint: 7A 23rd Floor, One Churchill Place London E14 5LN Direct line: +44 (0) 203 023 6016 Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000 Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001 www.london2012.com Find out what is going on at London 2012 HQ - http://blog.london2012.com

Lars, I've fixed the problem regarding strange dates appearing.
I'm wondering whether you could look at the problem whereby media releases are appearing in the news results.
A "media release" is simply a "News article" that is in the "Media/Press releases" section, so I guess that you just need to add a criterion to exclude this section (and its subsections). Alternatively, you could add a criterion to restrict searches to "News" (and its subsections).
Bounce this back to me if you're too busy.
Kieran
